::Dion::

Dion stops firing when he hears Pacifix's orders, eying the Decepticons hostilly.



--- In nbwrpg@y..., "rAuq" <rauq@t...> wrote:
> ooC at bottom.
> 
> --- Pacifix / Crossroads / Swoop ---
> 
> Pacifix was going to stop Grimlock from firing at the enemy 
> decepticons while they were retreating, but he has been dizzy 
> (yup, that's the excuse for not posting =P) from the destabilizer 
> ray. After fully recovering, he finds himself about to eat one of 
> Grimlock's missiles. Too late to dodge, he flinches, only to be 
> slammed out of the way by Crotale. He hits the ground and slide, 
> both him and Crotale missile the missile, which heads wildly into 
> the side of the mountain opposite from Grimlock. Pacifix shrugs off 
> the bad landing, and moves Crotale off of him, whispering, "Thanks 
> man, I own ya." He starts towards the decepticons, carefully 
> keeping out of the way of friendly fire. "Barricade mode." He 
> commands with authority. His second APC connects to his 
> unaltered body, adding on armour, and his assault cannons. He 
> arms his weapons, and prepares to fire. Before firing, he says to 
> his Autobots, "Hold your fire for a second," then he yells at the 
> Decepticons, "LEAVE NOW, OR BE FORCED TO SURRENDER." 
> He crouches, ready to dodge, and fire.
> 
> Crossroads, having recovered from... something, helps Grimlock to 
> his feet. "Uhh, you ok Grimlock?" He refrains from firing due to 
> Pacifix's words.
> 
> Swoop circles, making a pass at the enemy. He launches two A-G 
> (anti-grav, concussion, whatever tickles your fancy =P) missiles, 
> one at Caliburst and one at Tremor, then follows up with his laser 
> breath, loosing a light show in Tremor's direction.
> 
> 
> ooC: Nice subtle reminder that you want me to post with my 
> Autobots Jer. (Subject is wierd because I was bored.) =P
> 
> Dewboy, I don't have much time to post, in fact probably less than 
> you do, or will. You can't force the rpg to speed up, or slow down, 
> to get your posts to happen when YOU want them to. The rpg just 
> flows. You've got to wait a reasonable time before posting your next 
> messages. Try four hours for a start. To be frank, anything you do 
> with the mutants means little if not nothing to me. I just read the 
> post, and if it is good I enjoy it. I only concerns me when rules are 
> broken (or something like that). LN is right, if you want Mustex to 
> move, then you've got to post that he starts moving. For your next 
> post with Mustex, if he is going to travel anywhere, post that he 
> leaves in this sort of manner: (the following is not true, and isn't a 
> post, just and example)
> 
> 
> ::Mustex::
> Mustex: "Hmmm, my time here in northern Africa is done. I will 
> have about 2 hours to get to the Infecticon Base and meet with my 
> contact..."
> Mustex gets onto his hovercycle, revs his engine, and peels out of 
> the heavy folliage that he'd been hiding in. His path will take him to 
> the Infecticon base. He thinks to himself, "No time lose."
> 
> 
> In the above example, Mustex starts to leave for his destination. 
> Now he's left, you can post for him travelling along the way, or just 
> for him arriving, in several hours, our time. =)
> 
> Actually, I did respond to your weekly post proposal, and I said 
> that it would probably be ok (I wish you'd read all of my posts). I 
> suggest that you don't involve yourself in any large battles though, 
> they usually take more than a week to run to completion, and you 
> can't post everything in two days. What year is your Freshman 
> year? (Canada is different)
> 
> I hope you're still reading. About the Rocak thing. I still want you to 
> hold the posting about it, but if what you're writing about is a 
> flashback, and the tech is destroyed somehow, (including the 
> changes that happened to Mustex). How it is lost is up to you to 
> decide. It might be possible for Mustex to retain an ability or 
> something from the Rocak stuff, as long as you run it through the 
> Council.
> 
> As far as I know, you haven't written any profiles for your 
> characters, and submitted them to the nbwrpg site. To do that, give 
> Yan the username that you would like (it can be anything) and he'll 
> give you a password that you can change.
> 
> Replying to your ooC banter effective helps me waste my time, 
> needed for posting with my characters. I don't want to keep having 
> to do this. Also, do you have a permanent email address that 
> people (like the council for the most part) can talk to you about 
> your characters, weapons, ideas, and anything else might concern 
> you?
> 
> This ooC has been long, much too long, and I hope I don't have to 
> post many more like this...
